body: Your log is completely useless unfortunately, provide the `alacritty -vv --print-events` one.

Yeah, sorry I didn't have time to do a rebuild with the said commit yesterday, so I added the `xkbcli` output more for context.

Updated OP with actual logs.

<details>
<summary>Also here is the logs of a working build:</summary>

alacritty >>>```

</details>
I don't need the logs from the working build, I need the ones which don't work...

See edited opening post, folded in last line.

I'd say it boils essentially down to this:
```
event: KeyboardInput { device_id: DeviceId(X(DeviceId(3))), event: KeyEvent { physical_key: ArrowUp, logical_key: ArrowUp, text: None, location: Standard, state: Pressed, repeat: false, platform_specific: KeyEventExtra { key_without_modifiers: ArrowUp,        text_with_all_modifiers: None } }, is_synthetic: false }
event: KeyboardInput { device_id: DeviceId(X(DeviceId(3))), event: KeyEvent { physical_key: KeyE,    logical_key: ArrowUp, text: None, location: Standard, state: Pressed, repeat: true,  platform_specific: KeyEventExtra { key_without_modifiers: Character("o"), text_with_all_modifiers: None } }, is_synthetic: false }
```
The `physical_key: ArrowUp` works, the other does not.

issue.title: Prefer logical key for named keys
issue.body:
Some keyboard layouts have named logical keys via shift combinations of some sorts. So prefer them.

Fixes #7076.

body:
Thanks again for your quick response!

So this means no issue upstream at `winit` necessary, right?
@VuiMuich as you can see from the event log alacritty had all the information.
